intro: Tithymalodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky environments. Tithymalodes is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
